column1: The '''Drúadan''' language referred to the tongue of the [[Woses|Drúedain]].<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}
The voices of the Drúedain are said to have been "''deep and guttural''"
column2: <ref>{{UT|12}}</ref> possibly also describing the sound of their language as [[Ghân-buri-Ghân]]'s accent when using [[Westron]] is described with the very same words.<ref>{{RK|V5}}</ref><ref name=Fauskanger/>

column1: [[Helge Fauskanger]] has noted that the Drúadan tongue appears to be unrelated to the [[Westron|Common Speech]].<ref name=Fauskanger/> According to a late manuscript by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]
column2: it had possibly been influenced by [[Elvish]] (at least for the word ''[[gorgûn]]'').<ref>{{WJ|AC}}

column1: In a manuscript by Tolkien written in the late 1950s
column2: he uses the name ''Druadan'' (also referring to a member of the Drúedain in ''The Lord of the Rings''; amended to ''Drúadan'' in the second edition) for the language of the Woses.<ref name=PE17/>

column1: This seems to be the only occurrence where Tolkien uses a name for this tongue: since the manuscript was published as late as 2007
column2: fans and scholars have often used the unattested name '''''Drúedainic''''' to refer to the same tongue.<ref name=Fauskanger>[[Helge Fauskanger]]

column1: : The tongue of the Woses is called Pûkael
column2: said to be "''ideally suited to their voices and... alien to that of other Men''".<ref>{{ICE|2001}}
